text: Hi, I am finishing writing a book on graph mining in which I want to have everything implemented in both Python and Julia as a complementary material (a working repo for Python is here <https://github.com/ftheberge/GraphMiningNotebooks>). It would be great to know what is the status about releasing LightGraphs.jl 2.0 (I put on hold Julia implementation of the book to wait for this release). Thank you very much for any hints on this.

text:
I think the situation is a bit complicated, see here: <https://github.com/JuliaGraphs/LightGraphs.jl/issues/1506>.

My gut feeling is, that there probably will not be any mature release of LightGraphs 2.0 in the next half year.

Best would maybe to contact Seth - he is not here on slack anymore.

But for sure it slows down the whole development of LightGraphs, even now I don't know on which branch I should do changes at the moment and when these changes will be released

text:
a recap of the situation (may be subject to my interpretation)
• Seth wants a fork that will be based on LG 1.0 but with a non open-source license. It will be available though.
• LG 2.0 is in a sort of in-between non-polished states, some ideas from there are good but it was still not very usable as-is
• LG master will be reverted to the latest 1.x (currently the branch stable)
• A branch will be kept with the current master / 2.0 prototype for later experiments and integration
